null.verse 14:1: Alif lám rá! Toto je Písmo, jež jsme ti seslali, abys vyvedl lidi s dovolením Pána jejich z temnot ke světlu a ke stezce mocného, chvályhodného -
null.verse 14:2: Boha, jemuž náleží vše na nebesích i na zemi.
null.verse 14:3: - těm, kdo život pozemský více než budoucí milují, od cesty Boží odvádějí, a aby křivá byla, si přejí.
null.verse 14:4: A vyslali jsme každého posla jedině s jazykem lidu jeho, aby jim vše objasňoval.
null.verse 14:5: A věru jsme kdysi vyslali Mojžíše se znameními Našimi řkouce mu: "Vyveď lid svůj z temnoty ke světlu a připomínej jim dny Boží!" A věru jsou v tom znamení pro každého člověka trpělivého a vděčného.
null.verse 14:6: A hle, pravil Mojžíš lidu svému: "Pomněte dobrodiní Božího vůči vám; když zachránil vás před rodem Faraónovým, jenž zlá muka vám působil, syny vaše zabíjel a jen ženy vaše naživu nechával.
null.verse 14:7: A pomněte, když Pán váš prohlásil: Budete-li vděční, rozmnožíme pro vás dobré, budete-li však nevděční, pak věru trest Můj bude přísný!"
null.verse 14:8: I řekl Mojžíš dále: "Budete-li nevděční, vy, i kdož jsou na zemi všichni.
null.verse 14:9: Což nedošla vám zvěst o těch, kdož před vámi byli, o lidu Noemově, o ´Ádovcích a Thamúdovcích a těch, kdož po nich byli a o nichž všech jen Bůh ví? Přišli k nim poslové jejich s jasnými důkazy, však oni ruce své si do úst svých vložili a zvolali: "Nevěříme v to, s čím jste byli posláni, a věru jsme ohledně toho, k čemu nás vyzýváte, v pochybách hlubokých.
null.verse 14:10: A odpověděli poslové jejich: "Je snad pochybnost nějaká o Bohu, tvůrci nebes a země? On volá vás, aby vám mohl odpustit hříchy vaše a poskytl vám odklad do lhůty stanovené.
null.verse 14:11: A odpověděli poslové jejich: "Jsme vskutku pouze smrtelníci vám podobní, avšak Bůh zahrnuje přízní svou, koho chce ze služebníků svých.
null.verse 14:12: Proč bychom se neměli spoléhat na Boha, když nás již vedl po cestách našich? My budeme věru trpělivě snášet to, čím nám škodíte - a nechť na Boha se spoléhají ti, kdož naň se spoléhají!"
null.verse 14:13: A pravili ti, kdož nevěřící byli, k poslům svým: "Buď vás vyženeme ze své země, anebo se navrátíte k náboženství našemu!" A vnukl jim Pán jejich: "My vskutku nespravedlivé zahubíme
null.verse 14:14: a po nich vás na zemi usídlíme.
null.verse 14:15: A prosili o rozhodnutí Boží a byl zklamán každý tyran tvrdošíjný,
null.verse 14:16: a před ním peklo stojí, v němž napájen bude hnisem tekoucím
null.verse 14:17: po doušcích malých, jež málem ani nespolkne.
null.verse 14:18: Činy těch, kdož v Pána svého nevěří, se popelu podobají, nad nímž se vítr rozpoutal v den bouřlivý.
null.verse 14:19: Což nevidíš, že Bůh stvořil nebesa a zemi jako skutečnost? A kdyby se Mu zachtělo, nechal by vás zaniknout a přivedl by nové tvorstvo nějaké,
null.verse 14:20: a není to Bohu nikterak obtížné.
null.verse 14:21: A předstoupí všichni před Boha a řeknou slabí těm, kdož domýšliví byli: "My následovali jsme vás, jste nyní schopni nám nějak pomoci od trestu Božího?" A odpovědí: "Kdyby nás byl vedl Bůh, také bychom vás byli dobře vedli.
null.verse 14:22: A řekne satan, až věc bude rozhodnuta: "Bůh slib pravdivý vám přislíbil, já také jsem vám slib dal, ten však jsem nesplnil.
null.verse 14:23: zatímco ti, kdož věřili a zbožné skutky konali, do zahrad uvedeni budou, pod nimiž řeky tekou, a tam, nesmrtelní z dovolení Božího, slovy "Mír s vámi!" budou přivítáni.
null.verse 14:24: Což neviděls, jak Bůh uvádí podobenství o slovu dobrém? Je jako strom výtečný, jehož kořen je pevný a k nebesům se pne jeho větvoví,
null.verse 14:25: a plody v každé době přináší z Pána tvého dovolení.
null.verse 14:26: Slovo špatné pak podobá se stromu špatnému, jenž vyvrácen je nad zemí a jenž nemá vytrvalého stání.
null.verse 14:27: Bůh povzbuzuje ty, kdož uvěřili, slovem pevným v životě pozemském i budoucím, zatímco nespravedlivé nechává bloudit.
null.verse 14:28: Což neviděls ty, kdož vyměřili dobrodiní Boží za nevděk a umístili lid svůj v příbytku zatracení,
null.verse 14:29: v pekle, v němž hořet budou? Jak hnusné to bude místo přebývání!
null.verse 14:30: Oni Bohu rovné přidávali, aby lid od cesty Jeho svedli.
null.verse 14:31: Rci služebníkům Mým, kteří uvěřili, aby modlitbu konali a rozdávali z toho, co jsme jim uštědřili, skrytě i veřejně, dříve než přijde den, v němž nebude ani obchodování, ani přátelství.
null.verse 14:32: Bůh je ten, jenž stvořil nebesa a zemi a z nebe vodu seslal a z ní plodům pro obživu vaši vyrůst dal.
null.verse 14:33: a podčinil vám slunce a měsíc, jež neúnavně obíhají, a též noc a den vám podrobil
null.verse 14:34: a vše, oč žádali jste Jej, vám uštědřil.
null.verse 14:35: A hle, pravil Abraham: "Pane můj, učiň město toto bezpečným a oddal od nás, ode mne i synů mých, model uctívání,
null.verse 14:36: neboť, Pane můj, ony zbloudit daly již mnohým z lidí.
null.verse 14:37: Pane můj, usadil jsem část potomstva svého v údolí bez polí obilných poblíže chrámu Tvého posvátného, Pane náš, aby zde modlitbu konali.
null.verse 14:38: Pane náš, Ty dobře víš, co skrýváme i co najevo dáváme, a nic neskryje se před Bohem ani na nebi, ani na zemi.
null.verse 14:39: Chvála Bohu, jenž daroval mi přes stáří mé Ismaela a Izáka - a Pán můj věru dobře slyší vzývání.
null.verse 14:40: Pane můj, učiň, abych dodržoval modlitbu já i potomstvo mé a vyslyš, Pane náš, mé volání!
null.verse 14:41: Pane náš, odpusť mně i rodičům mým i věřícím v den, kdy nastane zúčtování!"
null.verse 14:42: Nedomnívej se, že Bohu je lhostejné, co nespravedliví konají; On pouze odklad jim dává do dne, kdy oči budou vytřeštěny,
null.verse 14:43: kdy lidé přijdou s krky nataženými a s hlavami strnule zdviženými, se zraky neschopnými se odvrátit a se srdci prázdnými.
null.verse 14:44: Varuj lidi přede dnem, kdy trest se k nim dostaví a kdy řeknou ti, kdož byli nespravedliví: "Pane náš, dej nám odklad do blízké lhůty a my pak odpovíme na výzvu Tvou a posly následovat budeme.
null.verse 14:45: Obývali jste příbytky těch, kdož před vámi sami sobě ukřivdili, a přece vám bylo jasné, jak s nimi jsme naložili, a příklady různé jsme vám uváděli.
null.verse 14:46: Oni úklady své chystali, však Bůh si s nimi ví rady, i kdyby úklady jejich byly takové, že horami by hýbaly.
null.verse 14:47: Nedomnívej se, že Bůh nedodrží slib Svůj prorokům daný - vždyť Bůh věru mocný je a pomsty je pánem
null.verse 14:48: v den, kdy země nahrazena bude zemí jinou a nebe jiným nebem a kdy lidé stanou před Bohem jediným, podmanitelem.
null.verse 14:49: V ten den pak spatříš hříšníky pospolu řetězy svázané,
null.verse 14:50: oděvy jejich ze smůly budou a tváře jejich ohněm pokryté,
null.verse 14:51: aby Bůh mohl odměnit duši každou za to, co si vysloužila, vždyť Bůh věru je rychlý v účtování.
null.verse 14:52: A toto je pro lidi sdělení, aby tím byli varováni a aby věděli, že On je Bůh jediný, a aby si to připomenuli ti, kdož jsou rozumní.

null.verse 14:2: Van God, aan Wie wat er ook in de hemelen en op aarde is, toebehoort.
null.verse 14:3: Die het tegenwoordige leven boven het Hiernamaals verkiezen en (anderen) van het pad van God afhouden het krom wensend - dezen zijn het die ver afgedwaald zijn.
null.verse 14:4: Wij zonden geen boodschapper dan met de taal van zijn volk, zodat hij (het) hun duidelijk moge maken.
null.verse 14:5: En Wij zonden Mozes met Onze tekenen, zeggende: "Breng uw volk uit de duisternis tot het licht en herinner hen aan de dagen van God.
null.verse 14:6: En toen Mozes tot zijn volk zeide: "Gedenk God’s gunst aan u toen Hij u van Pharao’s volk redde, dat u met een smartelijke foltering kwelde, uw zonen doodde en uw vrouwen spaarde; daarin was een grote beproeving van uw Heer.
null.verse 14:7: En toen uw Heer verklaarde: "Als je dankbaar zijt zal ik u rneer geven, maar als je ondankbaar zijt is Mijn straf inderdaad streng.
null.verse 14:8: En Mozes zeide: "Als je ondankbaar zijt, jij en al degenen die op aarde zijn, voorwaar, God is Zichzelf - genoeg, Geprezen.
null.verse 14:9: Zijn de tijdingen niet tot u gekomen van degenen die vóór u waren, het volk van Noach en van Aad en Samoed en degenen (die) na hen (kwamen)? Niemand behalve God kent ze.
null.verse 14:10: Hun boodschappers antwoordden: "Bestaat er twijfel over God, Schepper der hemelen en der aarde? Hij roept u, opdat Hij uw zonden moge vergeven en u uitstel moge verlenen voor een vastgestelde periode.
null.verse 14:11: Hun boodschappers zeiden tot hen: "Wij zijn inderdaad stervelingen zoals gij, maar God bewijst gunsten aan wie van Zijn dienaren Hij wil.
null.verse 14:12: "En waarom zouden wij niet in God vertrouwen wanneer Hij ons onze wegen heeft getoond? En wij zullen voorzeker al het kwaad dat je ons doet met geduld dragen.
null.verse 14:13: En de ongelovigen zeiden tot hun boodschappers: "Wij zullen u voorzeker uit het land verdrijven, tenzij je tot onze godsdienst wederkeert.
null.verse 14:14: "En Wij zullen u zeker na hen in het land vestigen.
null.verse 14:15: Zij vroegen om een oordeel en (dientengevolge) ging elke hoogmoedige vijand te gronde.
null.verse 14:16: Voor hem is de hel en hij zal worden gedwongen kokend water te drinken.
null.verse 14:17: Hij zal het met kleine teugen drinken en zal het ternauwernood kunnen slikken.
null.verse 14:18: De toestand dergenen die in hun Heer niet geloven, is, dat hun werken als as zijn waarop de wind hevig waait op een stormachtige dag.
null.verse 14:19: Ziet gij niet dat God de hemelen en de aarde in waarheid schiep? Als Hij het wil kan Hij u verdelgen en een nieuwe schepping voortbrengen.
null.verse 14:20: Dit is inderdaad niet moeilijk voor God.
null.verse 14:21: Zij zullen allen voor God verschijnen, dan zullen de zwakken tot de hoogmoedigen zeggen: "Wij waren voorzeker uw volgelingen; kunt gij ons dan tegen God’s straf niet helpen?" Zij zullen zeggen: "Als God ons had geleid, hadden wij u zeker geleid.
null.verse 14:22: Wanneer de zaak is beslist zal Satan zeggen: "God deed u een ware belofte, ik echter beloofde u en faalde, maar ik had geen macht over u dan dat ik u riep en je mij gehoorzaamde.
null.verse 14:23: En de gelovigen die goede werken doen, zullen in tuinen worden toegelaten waardoor rivieren stromen, daarin zullen zij vertoeven door het gebod van hun Heer.
null.verse 14:24: Ziet gij niet hoe God de gelijkenis van een goed woord geeft? Het is als een goede boom, waarvan de wortel hecht is en zijn takken reiken tot in de hemel.
null.verse 14:25: Deze brengt door het gebod van zijn Heer zijn vrucht voort in ieder jaargetijde.
null.verse 14:26: En een slecht woord is als een slechte boom die ontworteld ter aarde ligt en geen vaste grond meer heeft.
null.verse 14:27: God versterkt degenen, die geloven in het tegenwoordige leven en in het Hiernamaals met het bevestigende woord en God laat de onrechtvaardigen dwalen.
null.verse 14:28: Ziet gij niet degenen, die God’s gunst in ondankbaarheid veranderden en hun volk in het huis van verderf brachten?
null.verse 14:29: Dat is de hel.
null.verse 14:30: En zij hebben medegoden aan God toegekend om (de mensen) van Zijn weg af te leiden.
null.verse 14:31: Zeg tot mijn gelovige dienaren dat zij het gebed behoren te onderhouden en van hetgeen Wij hun hebben gegeven heimelijk en openlijk besteden, voordat er een dag komt, waarop er handel noch vriendschap zal zijn.
null.verse 14:32: God is Hij, Die de hemelen en de aarde schiep en water uit die wolken doet neerkomen en er vruchten voor uw onderhoud mee voortbrengt en Hij heeft de schepen in uw dienst gesteld, opdat zij door Zijn gebod over de zee mogen varen en Hij heeft de rivieren eveneens in uw dienst gesteld.
null.verse 14:33: En Hij heeft ook de zon en de maan, die beiden hun werk voortdurend verrichten alsmede de nacht en de dag in uw dienst gesteld.
null.verse 14:34: En Hij gaf u al hetgeen je van Hem vraagt en als je de gunsten van God telt, zul je ze stellig niet kunnen opsommen.
null.verse 14:35: En toen Abraham zeide: "Mijn Heer maak deze stad (oord van) vrede en weerhoud mij en mijn kinderen van het aanbidden van afgoden.
null.verse 14:36: Mijn Heer, zij hebben inderdaad vele van de mensen op een dwaalspoor gebracht.
null.verse 14:37: "Onze Heer, ik heb sommige van mijn kinderen in een onvruchtbaar dal dicht bij Uw heilig huis (de Kabah) gevestigd, onze Heer, opdat zij het gebed mogen houden.
null.verse 14:38: "Onze Heer, Gij weet voorzeker hetgeen wij verbergen en hetgeen wij bekend maken.
null.verse 14:39: "Alle lof behoort aan God, Die mij in weerwil van ouderdom Ismaël en Izaak heeft gegeven Waarlijk mijn Heer is de Verhoorder van het gebed.
null.verse 14:40: "Mijn Heer maak mij en mijn kinderen onderhouders van het gebed.
null.verse 14:41: "Onze Heer, vergeef mij en mijn ouders en de gelovigen op de Dag waarop de afrekening zal plaatsvinden.
null.verse 14:42: Denk niet dat God achteloos is omtrent hetgeen de onrechtvaardigen doen.
null.verse 14:43: Met opgeheven hoofd zich voorthaastend, terwijl zij hun blik niet kunnen afwenden en hun hart ledig is.
null.verse 14:44: En waarschuw de mensen voor de Dag waarop kastijding over hen zal komen; dan zullen de onrechtvaardigen zeggen: "Onze Heer, schenk ons uitstel voor een korte periode.
null.verse 14:45: En je vertoeft thans in de woonplaatsen van degenen die zichzelf onrecht aandeden en het was u duidelijk geworden hoe Wij met hen handelden terwijl Wij de voorbeelden voor u hadden gegeven.
null.verse 14:46: En zij hadden hun plannen reeds gesmeed maar hun plannen zijn bij God, al waren hun plannen zó dat er bergen door zouden worden verzet.
null.verse 14:47: Denk derhalve niet dat God zal falen Zijn belofte aan Zijn boodschappers te houden: God is voorzeker Almachtig, Heer der Vergelding.
null.verse 14:48: De dag (zal komen) waarop de aarde en de hemel door een andere aarde en hemel zullen worden vervangen; en zij (de mensen) allen voor God, de Ene, de Opperste zullen verschijnen.
null.verse 14:49: En op die Dag zul je de schuldigen in kettingen geklonken zien.
null.verse 14:50: Hun kleren zullen van pek zijn en het Vuur zal hun gezicht omhullen.
null.verse 14:51: Opdat God elke ziel moge vergelden voor hetgeen zij heeft gedaan.
null.verse 14:52: Dit is een aankondiging voor de mensen opdat zij er door mogen worden gewaarschuwd en opdat zij mogen weten dat Hij de Enige God is en opdat degenen die begrip hebben er lering uit mogen trekken.

Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 14:2: Allah, unto Whom belongeth whatsoever is in the heavens and whatsoever is in the earth.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 14:3: Those who love the life of the world more than the Hereafter, and debar (men) from the way of Allah and would have it crooked: such are far astray.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 14:4: And We never sent a messenger save with the language of his folk, that he might make (the message) clear for them.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 14:5: We verily sent Moses with Our revelations, saying: Bring thy people forth from darkness unto light.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 14:6: And (remind them) how Moses said unto his people: Remember Allah’s favour unto you when He delivered you from Pharaoh’s folk who were afflicting you with dreadful torment, and were slaying your sons and sparing your women; that was a tremendous trial from your Lord.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 14:7: And when your Lord proclaimed: If ye give thanks, I will give you more; but if ye are thankless, lo! My punishment is dire.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 14:8: And Moses said: Though ye and all who are in the earth prove thankless, lo! Allah verily is Absolute, Owner of Praise.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 14:9: Hath not the history of those before you reached you: the folk of Noah, and (the tribes of) A’ad and Thamud, and those after them ? None save Allah knoweth them.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 14:10: Their messengers said: Can there be doubt concerning Allah, the Creator of the heavens and the earth ? He calleth you that He may forgive you your sins and reprieve you unto an appointed term.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 14:11: Their messengers said unto them: We are but mortals like you, but Allah giveth grace unto whom He will of His slaves.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 14:12: How should we not put our trust in Allah when He hath shown us our ways ? We surely will endure the hurt ye do us.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 14:13: And those who disbelieved said unto their messengers: Verily we will drive you out from our land, unless ye return to our religion.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 14:14: And verily We shall make you to dwell in the land after them.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 14:15: And they sought help (from their Lord) and every froward potentate was bought to naught;
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 14:16: Hell is before him, and he is made to drink a festering water,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 14:17: Which he sippeth but can hardly swallow, and death cometh unto him from every side while yet he cannot die, and before him is a harsh doom.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 14:18: A similitude of those who disbelieve in their Lord: Their works are as ashes which the wind bloweth hard upon a stormy day.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 14:19: Hast thou not seen that Allah hath created the heavens and the earth with truth ? If He will, He can remove you and bring (in) some new creation;
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 14:20: And that is no great matter for Allah.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 14:21: They all come forth unto their Lord.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 14:22: And Satan saith, when the matter hath been decided: Lo! Allah promised you a promise of truth; and I promised you, then failed you.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 14:23: And those who believed and did good works are made to enter Gardens underneath which rivers flow, therein abiding by permission of their Lord, their greeting therein: Peace!
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 14:24: Seest thou not how Allah coineth a similitude: A goodly saying, as a goodly tree, its root set firm, its branches reaching into heaven,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 14:25: Giving its fruit at every season by permission of its Lord ? Allah coineth the similitudes for mankind in order that they may reflect.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 14:26: And the similitude of a bad saying is as a bad tree, uprooted from upon the earth, possessing no stability.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 14:27: Allah confirmeth those who believe by a firm saying in the life of the world and in the Hereafter, and Allah sendeth wrong-doers astray.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 14:28: Hast thou not seen those who gave the grace of Allah in exchange for thanklessness and led their people down to the Abode of Loss,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 14:29: (Even to) hell ? They are exposed thereto.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 14:30: And they set up rivals to Allah that they may mislead (men) from His way.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 14:31: Tell My bondmen who believe to establish worship and spend of that which We have given them, secretly and publicly, before a day cometh wherein there will be neither traffick nor befriending.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 14:32: Allah is He Who created the heavens and the earth, and causeth water to descend from the sky, thereby producing fruits as food for you, and maketh the ships to be of service unto you, that they may run upon the sea at His command, and hath made of service unto you the rivers;
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 14:33: And maketh the sun and the moon, constant in their courses, to be of service unto you, and hath made of service unto you the night and the day.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 14:34: And He giveth you of all ye ask of Him, and if ye would count the bounty of Allah ye cannot reckon it.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 14:35: And when Abraham said: My Lord! Make safe this territory, and preserve me and my sons from serving idols.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 14:36: My Lord! Lo! they have led many of mankind astray.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 14:37: Our Lord! Lo! I have settled some of my posterity in an uncultivable valley near unto Thy holy House, our Lord! that they may establish proper worship; so incline some hearts of men that they may yearn toward them, and provide Thou them with fruits in order that they may be thankful.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 14:38: Our Lord! Lo! Thou knowest that which we hide and that which we proclaim.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 14:39: Praise be to Allah Who hath given me, in my old age, Ishmael and Isaac! Lo! my Lord is indeed the Hearer of Prayer.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 14:40: My Lord! Make me to establish proper worship, and some of my posterity (also); our Lord! and accept my prayer.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 14:41: Our Lord! Forgive me and my parents and believers on the day when the account is cast.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 14:42: Deem not that Allah is unaware of what the wicked do.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 14:43: As they come hurrying on in fear, their heads upraised, their gaze returning not to them, and their hearts as air.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 14:44: And warn mankind of a day when the doom will come upon them, and those who did wrong will say: Our Lord! Reprieve us for a little while.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 14:45: And (have ye not) dwelt in the dwellings of those who wronged themselves (of old) and (hath it not) become plain to you how We dealt with them and made examples for you ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 14:46: Verily they have plotted their plot, and their plot is with Allah, though their plot were one whereby the mountains should be moved.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 14:47: So think not that Allah will fail to keep His promise to His messengers.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 14:48: On the day when the earth will be changed to other than the earth, and the heavens (also will be changed) and they will come forth unto Allah, the One, the Almighty,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 14:49: Thou wilt see the guilty on that day linked together in chains,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 14:50: Their raiment of pitch, and the Fire covering their faces,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 14:51: That Allah may repay each soul what it hath earned.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 14:52: This is a clear message for mankind in order that they may be warned thereby, and that they may know that He is only One God, and that men of understanding may take heed.

Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 14:2: Of God, to Whom do belong all things in the heavens and on earth! But alas for the Unbelievers for a terrible penalty (their Unfaith will bring them)!-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 14:3: Those who love the life of this world more than the Hereafter, who hinder (men) from the Path of God and seek therein something crooked: they are astray by a long distance.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 14:4: We sent not an apostle except (to teach) in the language of his (own) people, in order to make (things) clear to them.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 14:5: We sent Moses with Our signs (and the command).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 14:6: Remember! Moses said to his people: "Call to mind the favour of God to you when He delivered you from the people of Pharaoh: they set you hard tasks and punishments, slaughtered your sons, and let your women-folk live: therein was a tremendous trial from your Lord.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 14:7: And remember! your Lord caused to be declared (publicly): "If ye are grateful, I will add more (favours) unto you; But if ye show ingratitude, truly My punishment is terrible indeed.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 14:8: And Moses said: "If ye show ingratitude, ye and all on earth together, yet is God free of all wants, worthy of all praise.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 14:9: Has not the story reached you, (O people!), of those who (went) before you? - of the people of Noah, and ’Ad, and Thamud? - And of those who (came) after them? None knows them but God.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 14:10: Their apostles said: "Is there a doubt about God, The Creator of the heavens and the earth? It is He Who invites you, in order that He may forgive you your sins and give you respite for a term appointed!" They said: "Ah! ye are no more than human, like ourselves! Ye wish to turn us away from the (gods) our fathers used to worship: then bring us some clear authority.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 14:11: Their apostles said to them: "True, we are human like yourselves, but God doth grant His grace to such of his servants as He pleases.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 14:12: "No reason have we why we should not put our trust on God.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 14:13: And the Unbelievers said to their apostles: "Be sure we shall drive you out of our land, or ye shall return to our religion.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 14:14: "And verily We shall cause you to abide in the land, and succeed them.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 14:15: But they sought victory and decision (there and then), and frustration was the lot of every powerful obstinate transgressor.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 14:16: In front of such a one is Hell, and he is given, for drink, boiling fetid water.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 14:17: In gulps will he sip it, but never will he be near swallowing it down his throat: death will come to him from every quarter, yet will he not die: and in front of him will be a chastisement unrelenting.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 14:18: The parable of those who reject their Lord is that their works are as ashes, on which the wind blows furiously on a tempestuous day: No power have they over aught that they have earned: that is the straying far, far (from the goal).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 14:19: Seest thou not that God created the heavens and the earth in Truth? If He so will, He can remove you and put (in your place) a new creation?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 14:20: Nor is that for God any great matter.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 14:21: They will all be marshalled before God together: then will the weak say to those who were arrogant, "For us, we but followed you; can ye then avail us to all against the wrath of God?" They will reply, "If we had received the Guidance of God, we should have given it to you: to us it makes no difference (now) whether we rage, or bear (these torments) with patience: for ourselves there is no way of escape.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 14:22: And Satan will say when the matter is decided: "It was God Who gave you a promise of Truth: I too promised, but I failed in my promise to you.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 14:23: But those who believe and work righteousness will be admitted to gardens beneath which rivers flow,- to dwell therein for aye with the leave of their Lord.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 14:24: Seest thou not how God sets forth a parable? - A goodly word like a goodly tree, whose root is firmly fixed, and its branches (reach) to the heavens,- of its Lord.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 14:25: It brings forth its fruit at all times, by the leave of its Lord.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 14:26: And the parable of an evil Word is that of an evil tree: It is torn up by the root from the surface of the earth: it has no stability.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 14:27: God will establish in strength those who believe, with the word that stands firm, in this world and in the Hereafter; but God will leave, to stray, those who do wrong: God doeth what He willeth.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 14:28: Hast thou not turned thy vision to those who have changed the favour of God.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 14:29: Into Hell? They will burn therein,- an evil place to stay in!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 14:30: And they set up (idols) as equal to God, to mislead (men) from the Path! Say: "Enjoy (your brief power)! But verily ye are making straightway for Hell!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 14:31: Speak to my servants who have believed, that they may establish regular prayers, and spend (in charity) out of the sustenance we have given them, secretly and openly, before the coming of a Day in which there will be neither mutual bargaining nor befriending.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 14:32: It is God Who hath created the heavens and the earth and sendeth down rain from the skies, and with it bringeth out fruits wherewith to feed you; it is He Who hath made the ships subject to you, that they may sail through the sea by His command; and the rivers (also) hath He made subject to you.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 14:33: And He hath made subject to you the sun and the moon, both diligently pursuing their courses; and the night and the day hath he (also) made subject to you.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 14:34: And He giveth you of all that ye ask for.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 14:35: Remember Abraham said: "O my Lord! make this city one of peace and security: and preserve me and my sons from worshipping idols.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 14:36: "O my Lord! they have indeed led astray many among mankind; He then who follows my (ways) is of me, and he that disobeys me,- but Thou art indeed Oft-forgiving, Most Merciful.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 14:37: "O our Lord! I have made some of my offspring to dwell in a valley without cultivation, by Thy Sacred House; in order, O our Lord, that they may establish regular Prayer: so fill the hearts of some among men with love towards them, and feed them with fruits: so that they may give thanks.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 14:38: "O our Lord! truly Thou dost know what we conceal and what we reveal: for nothing whatever is hidden from God, whether on earth or in heaven.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 14:39: "Praise be to God, Who hath granted unto me in old age Isma’il and Isaac: for truly my Lord is He, the Hearer of Prayer!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 14:40: O my Lord! make me one who establishes regular Prayer, and also (raise such) among my offspring O our Lord! and accept Thou my Prayer.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 14:41: "O our Lord! cover (us) with Thy Forgiveness - me, my parents, and (all) Believers, on the Day that the Reckoning will be established!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 14:42: Think not that God doth not heed the deeds of those who do wrong.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 14:43: They running forward with necks outstretched, their heads uplifted, their gaze returning not towards them, and their hearts a (gaping) void!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 14:44: So warn mankind of the Day when the Wrath will reach them: then will the wrong-doers say: "Our Lord! respite us (if only) for a short term: we will answer Thy call, and follow the apostles!" "What! were ye not wont to swear aforetime that ye should suffer no decline?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 14:45: "And ye dwelt in the dwellings of men who wronged their own souls; ye were clearly shown how We dealt with them; and We put forth (many) parables in your behoof!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 14:46: Mighty indeed were the plots which they made, but their plots were (well) within the sight of God, even though they were such as to shake the hills!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 14:47: Never think that God would fail his apostles in His promise: for God is Exalted in power, - the Lord of Retribution.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 14:48: One day the earth will be changed to a different earth, and so will be the heavens, and (men) will be marshalled forth, before God, the One, the Irresistible;
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 14:49: And thou wilt see the sinners that day bound together in fetters;-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 14:50: Their garments of liquid pitch, and their faces covered with Fire;
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 14:51: That God may requite each soul according to its deserts; and verily God is swift in calling to account.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 14:52: Here is a Message for mankind: Let them take warning therefrom, and let them know that He is (no other than) One God: let men of understanding take heed.

Arthur J. Arberry.verse 14:2: God, to whom belongs all that is in the heavens and all that is in the earth.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 14:3: such as prefer the present life over the world to come, and bar from God’s way, desiring to make it crooked -- they are in far error.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 14:4: And We have sent no Messenger save with the tongue of his people, that he might make all clear to them; then God leads astray whomsoever He will, and He guides whomsoever He will; and He is the All-mighty, the All-wise.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 14:5: And We sent Moses with Our signs -- ’Bring forth thy people from the shadows to the light and remind thou them of the Days of God.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 14:6: And when Moses said to his people, ’Remember God’s blessing upon you when He delivered you from the folk of Pharaoh, who were visiting you with evil chastisement, slaughtering your sons, and sparing your women -- and in that was a grievous trial from your Lord.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 14:7: And when your Lord proclaimed, "If you are thankful, surely I will increase you, but if you are thankless My chastisement is surely terrible.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 14:8: And Moses said, ’If you are thankless, you and whoso is on earth, all together, yet assuredly God is All-sufficient, All-laudable.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 14:9: Has there not come to you the tidings of those who were before you -- the people of Noah, Ad, Thamood, and of those after them whom none knows but God? Their Messengers came to them with the clear signs; but they thrust their hands into their mouths, saying, ’We certainly disbelieve in the Message you have been sent with, and we are in doubt, concerning that you call us unto, disquieting.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 14:10: Their Messengers said, ’Is there any doubt regarding God, the Originator of the heavens and the earth, who calls you so that He may forgive you your sins, and defer you to a term stated?’ They said, ’You are nothing but mortals, like us; you desire to bar us from that our fathers served; then bring us a manifest authority.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 14:11: Their Messengers said to them, ’We are nothing but mortals, like you; but God is gracious unto whomsoever He will of His servants.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 14:12: And why should we not put our trust in God, seeing that He has guided us in our ways? We will surely endure patiently, whatever you hurt us; and in God let all put their trust who put their trust.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 14:13: The unbelievers said to their Messengers, ’We will assuredly expel you from our land, or you will surely return into our creed.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 14:14: and We will surely make you to dwell in the land after them -- that, for him who fears My station and fears My threat.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 14:15: They sought a judgment; then was disappointed every froward tyrant --
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 14:16: beyond him Gehenna, and he is given to drink of oozing pus,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 14:17: the which he gulps, and can scarce swallow, and death comes upon him from every side, yet he cannot die; and still beyond him is a harsh chastisement.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 14:18: The likeness of those who disbelieve in their Lord: their works are as ashes, whereon the wind blows strong upon a tempestuous day; they have no power over that they have earned - that is the far error!
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 14:19: Hast thou not seen that God created the heavens and the earth in truth? If He will, He can put you away and bring a new creation;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 14:20: that is surely no great matter for God.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 14:21: They sally forth unto God, all together; then say the weak to those who waxed proud, ’We were your followers; will you avail us against the chastisement of God anything?’ They say, ’If God had guided us, we would have guided you.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 14:22: And Satan says, when the issue is decided, ’God surely promised you a true promise; and I promised you, then I failed you, for I had no authority over you, but that I called you, and you answered me.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 14:23: but as for those who believe, and do deeds of righteousness, they shall be admitted to gardens underneath which rivers flow, therein dwelling forever, by the leave of their Lord, their greeting therein: ’Peace!’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 14:24: Hast thou not seen how God has struck a similitude? A good word is as a good tree -- its roots are firm, and its branches are in heaven;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 14:25: it gives its produce every season by the leave of its Lord.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 14:26: And the likeness of a corrupt word is as a corrupt tree -- uprooted from the earth, having no stablishment.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 14:27: God confirms those who believe with the firm word, in the present life and in the world to come; and God leads astray the evildoers; and God does what He will.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 14:28: Hast thou not seen those who exchanged the bounty of God with unthankfulness, and caused their people to dwell in the abode of ruin? --
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 14:29: Gehenna, wherein they are roasted; an evil stablishment!
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 14:30: And they set up compeers to God, that they might lead astray from His way.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 14:31: Say to My servants who believe, that they perform the prayer, and expend of that We have provided them, secretly and in public, before a day comes wherein shall be neither bargaining nor befriending.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 14:32: It is God who created the heavens and the earth, and sent down out of heaven water wherewith He brought forth fruits to be your sustenance.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 14:33: and He subjected to you the sun and moon constant upon their courses, and He subjected to you the night and day,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 14:34: and gave you of all you asked Him.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 14:35: And when Abraham said, ’My Lord, make this land secure, and turn me and my sons away from serving idols;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 14:36: my Lord, they have led astray many men.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 14:37: Our Lord, I have made some of my seed to dwell in a valley where is no sown land by Thy Holy House; Our Lord, let them perform the prayer, and make hearts of men yearn towards them, and provide them with fruits; haply they will be thankful.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 14:38: Our Lord, Thou knowest what we keep secret and what we publish; from God nothing whatever is hidden in earth and heaven.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 14:39: Praise be to God, who has given me, though I am old, Ishmael and Isaac; surely my Lord hears the petition.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 14:40: My Lord, make me a performer of the prayer, and of my seed.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 14:41: Our Lord, forgive Thou me and my parents, and the believers, upon the day when the reckoning shall come to pass.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 14:42: Deem not that God is heedless of what the evildoers work; He is only deferring them to a day when eyes shall stare,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 14:43: when they shall run with necks outstretched and heads erect, their glances never returned on themselves, their hearts void.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 14:44: And warn mankind of the day when the chastisement comes on them, And those who did evil shall say, ’Our Lord, defer us to a near term, and we will answer Thy call, and follow the Messengers.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 14:45: And you dwelt in the dwelling-places of those who wronged themselves, and it became clear to you how We did with them, and how We struck similitudes for you.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 14:46: They devised their devising, and their devising is known to God; though their devising were such as to remove mountains.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 14:47: So do not deem that God will fail in His promise to His Messengers; surely God is All-mighty, Vengeful.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 14:48: Upon the day the earth shall be changed to other than the earth, and the heavens and they sally forth unto God, the One, the Omnipotent.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 14:49: And thou shalt see the sinners that day coupled in fetters,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 14:50: of pitch their shirts, their faces enveloped by the Fire,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 14:51: that God may recompense every soul for its earnings; surely God is swift at the reckoning.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 14:52: This is a Message to be delivered to mankind that they may be warned by it, and that they may know that He is One God, and that all possessed of minds may remember.

Muhammad Asad.verse 14:2: to God, unto whom all that is in the heavens and all that is on earth, belongs.
Muhammad Asad.verse 14:3: awaits those who choose the life of this world as the sole object of their love, preferring it to [all thought of] the life to come, and who turn others away from the path of God and try to make it appear crooked.
Muhammad Asad.verse 14:4: AND NEVER have We sent forth any apostle otherwise than [with a message] in his own people’s tongue, so that he might make [the truth] clear unto them; but God lets go astray him that wills [to go astray], and guides him that wills [to be guided] – for He alone is almighty, truly wise.
Muhammad Asad.verse 14:6: indeed, have We sent forth Moses with Our messages [and this Our command]: "Lead thy people out of the depths of darkness into the light, and remind them of the Days of God!" Verily, in this
Muhammad Asad.verse 14:7: there are messages indeed for all who are wholly patient in adversity and deeply grateful [to God].
Muhammad Asad.verse 14:9: unto his people: "Remember the blessings which God bestowed upon you when He saved you from Pharaoh’s people who afflicted you with cruel suffering, and slaughtered your sons, and spared
Muhammad Asad.verse 14:10: your women – which was an awesome trial from your Sustainer.
Muhammad Asad.verse 14:11: And [remember the time] when your Sustainer made [this promise] known: ‘If you are grateful [to Me], I shall most certainly give you more and more; but if you are ungrateful, verily, My chastisement will be severe indeed!’"
Muhammad Asad.verse 14:13: deny the truth – you and whoever else lives on earth, all of you – [know that,] verily, God is indeed self-sufficient, ever to be praised!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 14:14: HAVE THE STORIES of those [deniers of the truth] who lived before you never yet come within your ken – [the stories of] the people of Noah, and of [the tribes of] ’ād and Thamūd, and of those who came after them? None knows them
Muhammad Asad.verse 14:16: Said the apostles sent unto them: "Can there be any doubt about [the existence and oneness of] God, the Originator of the heavens and the earth? It is He who calls unto you, so that He may forgive you [whatever is past] of your sins and grant you respite until a term [set by Him is fulfilled].
Muhammad Asad.verse 14:17: they replied: "You are nothing but mortal men like ourselves! You want to turn us away from what our forefathers were wont to worship: well, then, bring us a clear proof [of your being God’s message-bearers]!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 14:18: Their apostles answered them: "True, we are nothing but mortal men like yourselves: but God bestows His favour upon whomever He wills of His servants.
Muhammad Asad.verse 14:19: it is in God that all believers must place their trust.
Muhammad Asad.verse 14:20: And how could we not place our trust in God, seeing that it is He who has shown us the path which we are to follow? "Hence, we shall certainly bear with patience whatever hurt you may do us: for all who have trust [in His existence] must place their trust in God !"
Muhammad Asad.verse 14:21: But they who denied the truth spoke
Muhammad Asad.verse 14:22: unto their apostles: "We shall most certainly expel you from our land, unless you return forthwith to our ways!" Whereupon their Sustainer revealed this to His apostles: "Most certainly shall We destroy these evildoers,
Muhammad Asad.verse 14:23: and most certainly shall We cause you to dwell on earth
Muhammad Asad.verse 14:24: after they have passed away: this is [My promise] unto all who stand in awe of My presence, and stand in awe of My warning!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 14:25: And they prayed [to God] that the truth be made to triumph.
Muhammad Asad.verse 14:26: with hell awaiting him; and he shall be made to drink of the water of most bitter distress,
Muhammad Asad.verse 14:28: little by little, and yet hardly able to swallow it.
Muhammad Asad.verse 14:29: [This, then, is] the parable of those who are bent on denying their Sustainer: all their works are as ashes which the wind blows about fiercely on a stormy day: [in the life to come,] they cannot achieve any benefit whatever from all [the good] that they may have wrought: for this [denial of God] is indeed the farthest one can go astray.
Muhammad Asad.verse 14:30: ART THOU NOT aware that God has created the heavens and the earth in accordance with [an inner] truth? He can, if He so wills, do away with you and bring forth a new mankind [in your stead]:
Muhammad Asad.verse 14:31: nor is this difficult for God.
Muhammad Asad.verse 14:33: will appear before God [on the Day of Judgment]; and then the weak will say unto those who had gloried in their arrogance: "Behold, we were but your followers: can you, then, relieve us of something of God’s chastisement?" [And the others] will answer: "If God would but show us the way [to salvation], we would indeed guide you [towards it].
Muhammad Asad.verse 14:34: all one, as far as we are concerned, whether we grieve impatiently or endure [our lot] with patience: there is no escape for us!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 14:35: And when everything will have been decided, Satan will say: "Behold, God promised you something that was bound to come true! I, too, held out [all manner of] promises to you – but I deceived you.
Muhammad Asad.verse 14:36: refused to admit that there was any truth in your erstwhile belief that I had a share in God’s divinity.
Muhammad Asad.verse 14:37: But those who shall have attained to faith and done righteous deeds will be brought into gardens through which running waters flow, therein to abide by their Sustainer’s leave, and will be welcomed with the greeting, "Peace!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 14:38: ART THOU NOT aware how God sets forth the parable of a good word? [It is] like a good tree, firmly rooted, [reaching out] with its branches towards the sky,
Muhammad Asad.verse 14:39: yielding its fruit at all times by its Sustainer’s leave.
Muhammad Asad.verse 14:40: And the parable of a corrupt word is that of a corrupt tree, torn up [from its roots] onto the face of the earth, wholly unable to endure.
Muhammad Asad.verse 14:42: God grants firmness unto those who have attained to faith through the word that is unshakably true in the life of this world as well as in the life to come; but the wrongdoers He lets go astray: for God does whatever He wills.
Muhammad Asad.verse 14:43: ART THOU NOT aware of those who have preferred a denial of the truth to God’s blessings, and
Muhammad Asad.verse 14:44: invited their people to alight in that abode of utter desolation
Muhammad Asad.verse 14:46: will have to endure? And how vile a state to settle in!
Muhammad Asad.verse 14:47: For they claimed that there are powers that could rival God, and so they strayed from His path.
Muhammad Asad.verse 14:49: tell [those of] My servants who have attained to faith that they should be constant in prayer and spend [in Our way], secretly and openly, out of what We provide for them as sustenance, ere there come a Day when there will be no bargaining, and no mutual befriending.
Muhammad Asad.verse 14:50: [And remember that] it is God who has created the heavens and the earth, and who sends down water from the sky and thereby brings forth [all manner] of fruits for your sustenance; and who has made ships subservient to you, so that they may sail through the sea at His behest; and has made the rivers subservient [to His laws, so that they be of use] to you;
Muhammad Asad.verse 14:51: and has made the sun and the moon, both of them constant upon their courses, subservient [to His laws, so that they be of use] to you; and has made the night and the day subservient [to His laws, so that they be of use] to you.
Muhammad Asad.verse 14:53: does He give you something out of what you may be asking of Him; and should you try to count God’s blessings, you could never compute them.
Muhammad Asad.verse 14:54: AND [remember the time] when Abraham spoke :
Muhammad Asad.verse 14:55: "O my Sustainer! Make this land secure, and preserve me and my children from ever worshipping idols
Muhammad Asad.verse 14:56: for, verily, O my Sustainer, these [false objects of worship] have led many people astray! "Hence,
Muhammad Asad.verse 14:57: he who follows me [in this my faith] is truly of me; and as for him who disobeys me – Thou art, verily, much-forgiving, a dispenser of grace!
Muhammad Asad.verse 14:58: "O our Sustainer! Behold, I have settled some of my offspring in a valley in which there is no arable land, close to Thy sanctified Temple, so that, O our Sustainer, they might devote themselves to prayer: cause Thou, therefore, people’s hearts to incline towards them, and grant them fruitful sustenance, so that they might have cause to be grateful.
Muhammad Asad.verse 14:59: "O our Sustainer! Thou truly knowest all that we may hide [in our hearts] as well as all that we bring into the open: for nothing whatever, be it on earth or in heaven, remains hidden from God.
Muhammad Asad.verse 14:60: "All praise is due to God, who has bestowed upon me, in my old age, Ishmael and Isaac! Behold, my Sustainer hears indeed all prayer:
Muhammad Asad.verse 14:62: O my Sustainer, cause me and
Muhammad Asad.verse 14:63: of my offspring to remain constant in prayer! "And, O our Sustainer, accept this my prayer:
Muhammad Asad.verse 14:64: O our Sustainer, grant Thy forgiveness unto me, and my parents, and all the believers, on the Day on which the
Muhammad Asad.verse 14:66: AND DO NOT think that God is unaware of what the evildoers are doing: He but grants them respite until the Day when their eyes will stare in horror,
Muhammad Asad.verse 14:67: the while they will be running confusedly to and fro, with their heads upraised [in supplication], unable to look away from what they shall behold, and their hearts an abysmal void.

Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 14:2: Allah, the One to whom belongs what is in the heavens and what is in the earth.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 14:3: to those who prefer the worldly life to the Hereafter and prevent (people) from the way of Allah, and seek to make it crooked.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 14:4: We did not send any messenger but (speaking) in the language of his people, so that he might clearly convey the message to them.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 14:5: Surely, We sent Mūsā with Our signs saying to him, “Bring your people out of (all sorts of) darkness into the light, and remind them of the Days of Allah.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 14:6: And when Mūsā said to his people, “Remember Allah’s blessing upon you when He delivered you from Pharaoh’s people who had been inflicting a grievous torment on you, slaughtering your sons and leaving your women alive.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 14:7: (Recall the time) when your Lord declared, “If you express gratitude, I shall certainly give you more, and if you are ungrateful, then My punishment is severe.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 14:8: And Mūsā said, “If you and all those on earth become ungrateful, then Allah is free of all needs, worthy of every praise.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 14:9: Has there not come to you the news of those before you, the people of NūH, ‘Ād and Thamūd and of those after them.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 14:10: Their prophets said, “Is it in Allah that you have some doubt, who is the Creator of the heavens and the earth? He calls you, so that He may forgive you some of your sins and give you respite up to a specified term.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 14:11: Their prophets said to them, “We are no more than a human being like you, but Allah bestows His favour upon whom He wills from among His servants.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 14:12: What is wrong with us that we should not put our trust in Allah when He has guided us to our paths? We shall, of course, endure with patience all your persecutions; and all those who have to trust should trust only in Allah.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 14:13: The disbelievers said to their prophets, “We shall certainly expel you from our land unless you come back to our faith.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 14:14: and shall certainly let you dwell in the land after them.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 14:15: They sought final decision (by demanding the divine scourge), and (thus) every obstinate tyrant failed.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 14:16: The Hell is pursuing him, and he shall be made to drink pus-fluid,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 14:17: which he will arduously sip, and will not be able to swallow.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 14:18: The deeds of those who refuse to believe in their Lord are like ashes blown away by the wind on a stormy day.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 14:19: Have you not seen that Allah has created the heavens and the earth with truth? If He wills, He can put you away and bring a new creation;
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 14:20: and that is not at all difficult for Allah.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 14:21: All of them shall appear before Allah.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 14:22: The Satan will say when the matter will have been decided, “Allah promised you a truthful promise while I gave you a promise and did not fulfill it.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 14:23: And those who believed and did good deeds shall be admitted to Gardens beneath which rivers flow, living there forever by the will of Allah.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 14:24: Have you not seen how Allah has set forth a parable: A good word is like a good tree, having its root firm and its branches in the sky.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 14:25: It brings its fruits at all times with the will of its Lord.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 14:26: And the parable of a bad word is like a bad tree, removed from the top of the soil, having no firm root.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 14:27: Allah keeps the believers firm with the stable word in the worldly life and in the Hereafter; and Allah lets the unjust go astray; and Allah does what He wills.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 14:28: Have you not seen those who adopted disbelief in exchange of Allah’s favor and caused their people to disembark at a land of total destruction,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 14:30: They have set up partners with Allah, so that they may mislead (the people) from His path.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 14:31: Say to My believing servants that they should establish Salāh and spend, secretly and openly, out of what We have given to them before there comes a day in which there is neither a trade nor friendship.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 14:32: Allah is the One who created the heavens and the earth and sent down water from the sky, then brought forth with it sustenance for you from the produce, and subjugated for you the ships, so that they may sail in the sea with His command, and subjugated for you the rivers;
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 14:33: and He subjugated for you the sun and the moon, moving constantly, and subjugated for you the day and the night,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 14:34: and He gave you whatever you asked for.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 14:35: (Recall) when Ibrāhīm said, “My Lord, make this city peaceful, and keep me and my children away from worshiping idols.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 14:36: My Lord, they have misled many a people.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 14:37: Our Lord, I have settled some of my children in a valley of no vegetation, close to Your sanctified House, so that, Our Lord, they may establish Salāh.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 14:38: Our Lord, surely You know what we conceal and what we reveal.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 14:39: Praise be to Allah who, despite my old age, blessed me with Ismā‘īl (Ishmael) and IsHāq (Isaac).
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 14:40: My Lord, make me steadfast in Salāh, and my offspring as well.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 14:41: Our Lord, forgive me and my parents and all believers on the day when reckoning shall take place.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 14:42: Never think that Allah is unaware of what the wrongdoers are doing.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 14:43: They shall be rushing with their heads raised upward; their eyes shall not return towards them and their hearts shall be hollow.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 14:44: Warn the people of a day when punishment will come upon them, and the wrongdoers will say, “Our Lord, give us respite for a short term, and we will respond to Your call and will follow the messengers.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 14:45: And you dwelt in the dwellings of those who wronged themselves, and it became clear to you how We dealt with them, and We put forth for you the examples.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 14:46: And they worked out their plot and whatever they plot is before Allah, even though their plot is such as would move the mountains.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 14:47: So, never think that Allah will do against His promise to His messengers.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 14:48: the day on which this earth will be turned into some other earth, and the skies as well, and they all shall appear before Allah, the One, the All-Dominant.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 14:49: On that day you will see the culprits tied up together in chains,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 14:50: their shirts will be of rosin, and their faces will be covered with Fire
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 14:51: so that Allah repays everyone in full whatever he earned.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 14:52: This is a message for mankind, so that they (take lesson and) be warned, and so that they may know that He is One God, and so that the people of understanding may observe the advice.

Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 14:14: Their Messengers said to them: ‘Though (in constitution of self) we are humans like you, but (also mark the difference that) Allah favours whom He likes of His servants.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 14:15: And what is the matter with us that we should not put our trust in Allah, whilst He alone has shown us the paths (of guidance and success)?
